item.title: Top 5 IT firms shed 2,500 jobs in Q3FY25 after a quarter of additions - Moneycontrol
item.description:
Top 5 IT Firms Shed 2,500 Jobs in Q3FY25 After a Quarter of Additions

Date: January 18, 2025 / Source: Moneycontrol

India’s top five IT firms witnessed a reduction of 2,587 employees in Q3FY25 after a strong hiring quarter, signaling ongoing challenges in the sector despite a cautious revival.

  • The top five IT services companies are Tata Consultancy Services (TCS), Infosys, HCLTech, Wipro, and Tech Mahindra.
  • This quarter marked a seasonal dip in hiring due to typical furloughs.
  • In Q2FY25, these firms had added 15,033 employees, contrasting with the current job cuts.
  • HCLTech and Infosys were the only companies to report an increase in headcount during this quarter.
"On a positive note, these firms added 10,412 employees in 9MFY25, marking a cautious revival after losing over 57,608 employees during the same period in FY24."

This current trend highlights the volatility in the IT job market and the need for firms to adapt to changing demands.

item.title: Buy or sell: Sumeet Bagadia recommends three stocks to buy next week - Mint
item.description:
Sumeet Bagadia Recommends Three Stocks to Buy Next Week

Date: January 14, 2023
Source: Live Mint

Sumeet Bagadia's Stock Picks

In the wake of a decline in the Indian stock market, Sumeet Bagadia from Choice Broking recommends three stocks for investors: Coal India Limited, BSE, and Tata Steel.

Key Points:

  • The Indian stock market closed lower for the third consecutive session.
  • Bagadia indicates a cautious market sentiment with Nifty 50 facing resistance at 23,500 points.
  • Recommended stocks include:
  • 1) Coal India Limited: Buy at ₹387.65, target ₹430, stop loss ₹368.
  • 2) BSE: Buy at ₹5998.75, target ₹6650, stop loss ₹5690.
  • 3) Tata Steel: Buy at ₹130.28, target ₹146, stop loss ₹122.

Notable Quotes:

"Investors should maintain a stock-specific approach. Breaking above the resistance is crucial for improving market sentiments." - Sumeet Bagadia

Conclusion:

Investors are advised to take a cautious yet strategic approach with these stock recommendations as market conditions fluctuate.

item.title: AGR Dues Waiver: In a relief to Jio, Airtel, govt weighs Rs 1 lakh cr Relief for Telcos - DNA India
item.description:
AGR Dues Waiver: In a relief to Jio, Airtel, govt weighs Rs 1 lakh cr Relief for Telcos

Date: January 18, 2025 | Source: DNA India

The government is considering a major proposal to ease the financial burden on telecom companies due to substantial AGR dues following a Supreme Court ruling. This relief could provide over ₹1 lakh crore, primarily benefiting Vodafone Idea, which has been struggling significantly.

  • The proposal includes waiving 50% interest and 100% penalties related to the AGR dues.
  • Vodafone Idea stands to benefit the most, receiving over ₹52,000 crore in relief.
  • Bharti Airtel may see a reduction of nearly ₹38,000 crore in dues.
  • The plan aims to enhance competition in the telecom sector and prevent a duopoly.
  • Part of the relief package may be unveiled during the upcoming February 1 budget announcement.
“The proposal is being discussed at the highest level including the finance ministry, the telecom department and the cabinet secretariat.”

This initiative marks a significant action from the government following the heightened financial struggles in the telecom industry post the 2019 Supreme Court ruling imposing nearly ₹1.47 lakh crore in AGR dues.

item.title: Kalyan Jewellers share price: Why Budget 2025 holds key for this jewellery stock? - Mint
item.description:
Kalyan Jewellers share price: Why Budget 2025 holds key for this jewellery stock?

Date: Not specified Source: LiveMint

After reaching a record high, Kalyan Jewellers' stock is currently experiencing a significant decline. Experts suggest that upcoming government decisions in Budget 2025 could impact the share price positively.

Key Points:

  • Kalyan Jewellers' share price fell by 37% since its all-time high of ₹795.40.
  • Pending customs duty changes on gold could benefit the company's stock price.
  • Market analysts suggest shareholders hold their investments with a stop-loss recommendation.
  • Future price targets for the stock may reach between ₹575 and ₹595 if the trend reverses.
“Investors should remain cautious but optimistic, as the anticipated duty hike could turn into a tailwind for Kalyan Jewellers.” - Sugandha Sachdeva

The anticipated changes in customs duties on gold are viewed as critical to the potential recovery of Kalyan Jewellers' stock price, marking it as a key situation to monitor for investors.

item.title: RBL Bank Q3 Results: Net profit sinks 86% to ₹32 crore on high provisions, NII up 3% YoY; NPA improves marginally - Mint
item.description:
RBL Bank Q3 Results: Net profit sinks 86% to ₹32 crore on high provisions, NII up 3% YoY; NPA improves marginally

Date: January 18, 2024 | Source: LiveMint

RBL Bank reported a significant drop of 86% in net profit for Q3 FY25, while its net interest income increased by 3% year-on-year. NPA figures show a slight improvement.

  • Net profit for Q3 FY25 is ₹32.6 crore, down from ₹233.1 crore last year.
  • Net interest income (NII) rose to ₹1,585 crore.
  • Gross NPA ratio increased to 2.92% but remains lower than 3.12% from a year ago.
  • Net NPA ratio decreased to 0.53%.
  • Provisions jumped to ₹1,189 crore from ₹458 crore year-on-year.
  • Exceptional net gain of ₹144.15 crore from selling a 10% stake in DAM Capital.
“We remain cautious about the short-term challenges emanating from macro-economic environment affecting certain unsecured lending segments,” said R Subramaniakumar, MD & CEO, RBL Bank.

Overall, RBL Bank's management highlighted a commitment to growth while maintaining a customer-centric approach.

item.title: Should You Buy India’s New Luxury 7-Seater SUV? - MotorOctane
item.description:
Should You Buy India’s New Luxury 7-Seater SUV?

Publication Date: N/A Source: MotorOctane

Hyundai has unveiled its flagship electric SUV, the Ioniq 9, in India. This new 7-seater EV aims to compete with the Kia EV9, featuring Hyundai’s eGMP platform for flexibility and practicality.

  • Bold design with Parametric Pixel aesthetics.
  • Spacious interior featuring advanced technology and comfort features.
  • Available powertrains include RWD and AWD configurations.
  • Expected launch in India in the second half of 2025.
  • Luggage space of up to 620 litres with the ability to accommodate three rows of seats.
"The new Ioniq 9 is designed with body-coloured cladding and offers a flat floor for unique interior features."

This SUV represents Hyundai's commitment to combining luxury with sustainability, making it a strong candidate for buyers looking for an electric family vehicle.

item.title: Hyundai and TVS Motor explore partnership for last-mile mobility solutions in India - Autocar Professional
item.description:
Hyundai and TVS Motor Explore Partnership for Last-Mile Mobility Solutions in India

Publication Date: Not Available Source: Not Available

Hyundai Motor Company and TVS Motor Company announced at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025 their exploration of a partnership to develop advanced electric three-wheelers and micro four-wheelers.

  • The partnership aims to address India's demand for last-mile connectivity solutions with a focus on sustainability.
  • Hyundai will provide design and technology expertise, while TVS will handle manufacturing and marketing.
  • Hyundai's new Micro Mobility Concepts include a modernized Electric Three-Wheeler, designed for urban environments.
  • Key features of the Electric Three-Wheeler include eco-friendly designs suited for logistics and emergency response.
  • Both companies are considering scaling these vehicles for global markets.
“Hyundai is a customer-centric brand, and our mission is to care for people in India by designing micro-mobility solutions tailored to its unique environment.” - SangYup Lee, Executive Vice President and Head of Hyundai and Genesis Global Design.

In conclusion, this collaboration aims to innovate and enhance last-mile connectivity solutions in India, potentially shaping the future of urban mobility.

item.title: Jio Coin launched? User claims Mukesh Ambani's new cryptocurrency is live and 'you can accumulate coins on - The Economic Times
item.description:
Jio Coin launched? User claims Mukesh Ambani's new cryptocurrency is live and you can accumulate coins.

Publication Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

Jio Platforms, led by Mukesh Ambani, has reportedly launched a new reward token called JioCoin on the Polygon blockchain network. The launch has sparked discussions on its potential uses, though the company has not yet disclosed official details about the token’s functionality.

  • JioCoin is integrated into JioSphere and rewards users for browsing online.
  • Currently, the token is not transferable or redeemable.
  • It may be used for services such as mobile recharges or purchases at Reliance gas stations in the future.
  • The launch comes amid strict regulations on cryptocurrencies in India.
  • Jio Platforms serves over 450 million users, playing a significant role in India's digital economy.
— simplykashif (@simplykashif)

The future of JioCoin remains uncertain but could have significant implications as it becomes integrated into Jio's ecosystem.

item.title: Bonus issue + share split: Stock under Rs 300 to trade ex-date next week - Ratio, record date - ET Now
item.description:
Bonus issue + share split: Stock under Rs 300 to trade ex-date next week - Ratio, record date

Updated on: Jan 18, 2025

Shares of a micro-cap company, BN Rathi Securities, will be trading ex-date for a bonus issue and stock split next week. The board has set a record date for these corporate actions.

  • BN Rathi Securities will issue 1 bonus share for each share held as of the record date.
  • A total of 2,07,50,000 bonus shares will be issued.
  • The record date for determining eligibility for the bonus shares and stock split is set for January 24.
  • The stock will be split in a 1:2 ratio, reducing the face value from Rs 10 to Rs 5.
  • Current share price is under Rs 300, with recent fluctuations noted on the BSE.
"The split is aimed at enhancing liquidity and making shares more economical for investors."

This announcement from BN Rathi Securities is geared towards increasing shareholder participation and market accessibility.

item.title: Stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommend five shares to buy on Monday — 20 January 2025 - Mint
item.description:
Stocks to buy under ₹100: Experts recommend five shares to buy on Monday — 20 January 2025

Publication Date: 20 January 2025   Source: Live Mint

Introduction

The Indian stock market faced its third consecutive decline due to weak global sentiments, but experts have identified five promising stocks under ₹100 to consider buying this Monday.

Key Points

  • The Nifty 50 index fell by 108 points to 23,203, while the BSE Sensex dropped 423 points to 76,619.
  • Smaller stocks showed resilience with gains in the Nifty Mid-cap 100 and Nifty Small-cap 100 indices.
  • Market experts recommend five stocks under ₹100: South Indian Bank, Arihant Capital Markets, IDBI Bank, IRB Infrastructure Developers, and Paramount Communications.
  • Key upcoming factors include corporate earnings results and Donald Trump's inauguration affecting market sentiment.

Notable Quotes

“The short-term trend of the Nifty 50 index remains weak amidst range movement.” - Nagaraj Shetti
“Traders are advised to adopt a sell-on-bounce strategy unless Bank Nifty holds above 49,910.” - Hrishikesh Yedve

Conclusion

Investors are advised to monitor both the market trends and expert recommendations closely as new developments unfold.

item.title: New Himalayan Rival Unveiled At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
TVS Launches Exciting New Adventure Motorcycle at Auto Expo

Publication Date: January 2025
Source: MotorOctane

The Indian motorcycle industry is on the rise as TVS unveils its latest model, the TVS ADV, featuring a powerful new 300cc engine and an adventurous design.

  • The TVS ADV features a muscular design inspired by the Ducati Multistrada.
  • It comes equipped with a 299cc engine producing 35 bhp and 28.5 Nm of torque.
  • The motorcycle showcases a half-fairing design with advanced safety features like switchable dual-channel ABS.
  • The launch price is expected to be around Rs 2.8 lakh, competing with models like KTM ADV 250 and Bajaj Dominar 250.
“The new motorcycle is expected to launch this year, marking a significant entry into the adventure segment.”

The launch of the TVS ADV marks a notable development in the growing Indian adventure motorcycle market, promising enhanced performance and style.

item.title: Google CEO Sundar Pichai shares congratulatory message for Amazon founder Jeff Bezos - The Times of India
item.description:
Google CEO Sundar Pichai shares congratulatory message for Amazon founder Jeff Bezos

Date: October 2023 Source: Times of India

In a recent statement, Google CEO Sundar Pichai extended his congratulations to Amazon founder Jeff Bezos on his achievements in the tech industry. Pichai's message highlights the spirit of innovation and collaboration in the tech community.

  • Sundar Pichai praises Jeff Bezos for his visionary leadership.
  • The congratulatory message emphasizes innovation and competition.
  • This interaction highlights positive relations in the tech industry.
"The tech industry thrives on innovation, and your contributions have been remarkable." - Sundar Pichai

This message reflects a mutual respect within the technology sector, as leaders acknowledge each other's contributions to the industry.

item.title: New Mahindra XUV700 Rival Unveiled At Auto Expo! - MotorOctane
item.description:
BYD Unveils Sealion 7 Coupe SUV at Auto Expo 2025

Publication Date: 2025-01-11 Source: MotorOctane

BYD, the world’s largest electric vehicle manufacturer, has unveiled the Sealion 7, its fourth product for India, at Auto Expo 2025, boasting impressive range and performance.

  • The BYD Sealion 7 features an aerodynamic design with key highlights like LED headlamps and sporty bumpers.
  • Dimensions of the Sealion 7 are 4.8m in length, 1.9m in width, and a wheelbase of 3m.
  • Interior includes premium Nappa leather and advanced features like a 15.6-inch touchscreen and 11 airbags for safety.
  • Powertrain options include a single motor RWD variant with 308bhp and a dual motor AWD variant with 523bhp.
  • Bookings are open with a token amount of Rs 70,000, offering a 7-year warranty for early customers.
"Customers looking for the perfect blend of performance and comfort will find the BYD Sealion 7 appealing."

The Sealion 7 is set to redefine the coupe SUV segment in India, promising a blend of luxury, safety, and sustainability.

item.title: High FD rates: THESE 10 banks offer over 8% interest on fixed deposits | Check latest rates here - Mint
item.description:
High FD rates: THESE 10 banks offer over 8% interest on fixed deposits | Check latest rates here

Publication Date: [Insert Date Here] | Source: Live Mint

For conservative investors who avoid taking risks, fixed deposits (FDs) provide a reliable, consistent long-term investment return. Currently, several banks in India offer interest rates over 8% on FDs, with small finance banks typically providing higher rates than public, private, and foreign banks.

FD rates of small finance banks

  • NorthEast Small Finance Bank: Interest of 9.00% for a period of 546 days to 1111 days.
  • Unity Small Finance Bank: Interest rate of 9.00% for 1001-day tenure.
  • Suryoday Small Finance Bank: A return of 8.60% for FDs from 2 to 3 years.
  • Jana Small Finance Bank: Interest rate of 8.25% for 1 to 3 years.
  • Utkarsh Small Finance Bank: Return of 8.50% for 2 years to 3 years.
  • Equitas Small Finance Bank: Interest rate of 8.25% for 888 days.

FD rate of Public sector banks

Public sector banks provide lower interest rates but are preferred by many for their reliability.

  • Central Bank of India: 7.50% for a tenure of 1111 or 3333 days.
  • Bank of Maharashtra: Interest of 7.45% for 366 days.
  • Canara Bank: 7.40% interest for 3 years to less than 5 years.
  • Indian Bank: 7.30% for a 400-day tenure.
  • Union Bank of India: 7.30% for 456 days.

FD rates of Private sector Banks

  • Bandhan Bank: 8.05% for a 1-year tenure.
  • DCB Bank: 8.05% for 19 months to 20 months.
  • RBL Bank: 8.00% for 500 days.
  • IndusInd Bank: 7.99% for 1 year 5 months to less than 1 year 6 months.
  • IDFC First Bank: 7.90% for 400 to 500 days.
  • HDFC Bank: 7.40% for 4 years 7 months (55 months).
  • ICICI Bank: 7.25% for 15 months to 2 years.

FD rates of foreign banks

  • Deutsche Bank: 8.00% for Above 1 year to 3 years.
  • Standard Chartered Bank: 7.50% for 1 year to 375 days.
  • HSBC Bank: 7.50% for a tenure of 601 to 699 days.

item.title: VinFast VF 6 Revealed In India At The Auto Expo 2025 - CarDekho
item.description:
VinFast VF 6 Electric SUV Unveiled at Auto Expo 2025 in India

Publication Date: Not specified | Source: CarDekho.com

The VinFast VF 6, a new electric SUV, made its debut in India at the Bharat Mobility Global Expo 2025. This vehicle aims to combine futuristic design with practical electric performance.

  • The VF 6 features a front-wheel-drive (FWD) system and has a claimed range of up to 399 km.
  • The compact SUV can accommodate up to five passengers.
  • It utilizes a 59.6 kWh battery pack, promising a range of around 410 km.
  • Its launch in India is anticipated in September, with prices starting around Rs 35 lakh (ex-showroom).

The VinFast VF 6 showcases a modern aesthetic with plush interiors equipped with advanced features including a 12.9-inch touchscreen and auto AC. It comes with multiple safety features including advanced driver-assistance systems.

Source: CarDekho.com

item.title: Crypto industry skeptical of memecoin promoted on Trump's social media - Cointelegraph
item.description:
Crypto Industry Doubts Memecoin Promotion by Trump

Publication Date: January 18, 2025 Source: CoinTelegraph

With Donald Trump promoting a new Solana-based memecoin, the crypto industry is skeptical about the legitimacy of the posts from his social media accounts.

  • Trump announced the memecoin on January 18 through social media, stating, “My NEW Official Trump Meme is HERE!”
  • The memecoin, named Official Trump (TRUMP), quickly rose to a market cap of $8.3 billion shortly after launch.
  • Industry experts are questioning if Trump's accounts were hacked, particularly with his inauguration approaching.
  • While some believe the posts are authentic, many feel uneasy about investing in the token.
  • Solana's price surged 4.12% following the memecoin launch, trading at $228.
“If it’s a hack, then this is going to severely mute Trump’s bullishness on crypto right as he takes office (bearish).” - Max Schwartman

The promotion of the TRUMP memecoin has led to uncertainty in the market, with analysts divided on its legitimacy and the potential impact on the cryptocurrency landscape.
